intro: Astragalus davuricus f. huangfuchuanensis, commonly known as the Huangfuchuan milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest for its potential medicinal properties.
